frameDefinitions: An Agent or Cause removes a piece of Information from a Document such that it cannot be retrieved.
A Speaker declares that they will no longer be involved with the Content.
The action of an Agent or the occurrence of a Cause event returns an Entity to an earlier  state of vigor and strength.
The words in this frame describe the process of making amends for some (wrongful) action (the Injury) committed by the Wrongdoer.
Temporary or permanent Styles and Configurations of Hair, as well as its inherent Nature.
An Agent has committed a Wrong in the past and is making Amends for it.
frameExamples: I <t>deleted</t> the last line from my essay.
That will only be possible if and when the IRA <t>renounces</t> armed struggle.
Falling prices and wireless connectivity have <t>breathed new life</t> into the PDA market.
On either side her head gleamed coiled <t>braids</t> of dark-gold hair , almost pale copper in the subdued light of the room .
He <t>atoned</t> for his sin with good works.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who removes the <fen>Information</fen>.
The thing that the <fen>Agent</fen> removes from the <fen>Document</fen>.
A non-agentive entity that removes the <fen>Information</fen>.
The collection of pieces of information from which the specific <fen>Information</fen> is removed.
The time when the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> removes the <fen>Information</fen> from the <fen>Document</fen>.
The location in which the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> removes the <fen>Information</fen> from the <fen>Document</fen>.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who communicates their cessation of association with the <fen>Content</fen>.
The idea that the <fen>Speaker</fen> no longer associates with, whether it be an activity, a propostion, or a group.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement of renunciation.
The time when the statement is made.
The role specifies the place where the statement takes place.
The concrete or abstract thing that is brought into an earlier state in which it was more effective and powerful.
The <fen>Agent</fen> puts the <fen>Entity</fen> into a state of renewed vigor.
An event or state whose occurrence brings about the <fen>Entity</fen>'s return to a vigorous state.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the renewal of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the Agent brings about the change in the <fen>Entity</fen>'s state.
The <fen>Injured_party</fen> was affected by some previous wrongful act of the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> and who should benefit from the reparations.
The <fen>Injury</fen> is the injurious action that  the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> committed against the <fen>Injured_party</fen>.  Although conceptually present, this role need not always be realized.
The <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> makes amends to the <fen>Injured_party</fen> for the <fen>Injury</fen>.
The <fen>Benefiting_action</fen> is performed by the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> to make amends.
<fen>Gift</fen> identifies the entity that the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> gives to the <fen>Injured_party</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when amends are made.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> makes amends.
This role is the hair itself
This role is the Possessor of the body part.
Temporary Configurations of hair (eg braid, bun, ponytail).   Something done to the hair merely by movement.
A property of the hair (eg curly, fine, brown).  This acts much like 'Descriptor' in the Observable_bodyparts Frame.  Colors, styles, natural properties are described by this frame element.
The <fen>Agent</fen> has committed a <fen>Wrong</fen> and is making <fen>Amends</fen>.
<fen>Wrong</fen> identifies the act committed by the <fen>Agent</fen> for which <fen>Amends</fen> are made.
<fen>Amends</fen> marks expressions that indicate what the <fen>Agent</fen> does to compensate for the <fen>Wrong</fen> that was committed.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> atones for the <fen>Wrong</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Agent</fen> expiates the <fen>Wrong</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Bonnie Charlie then renounced <fex>his aspirations to the throne</fex>.
Castro renounced all involvement with the group <fex>over the radio</fex>.
The reinvigoration <fex>of the tourism</fex> economy is recognised by many as an ambitious but necessary objective.
<fex>We</fex> revitalized the Golden Mountaineer Card, and we gave seniors a prescription drug benefit.
Rock has been rejuvenated creatively and commercially <fex>by hip-hop-inspired rock acts</fex>.
Production was revitalized <fex>last June</fex>.

New York's distinction as America's tax cut leader has revitalized the economy
<fex>in every corner of the state</fex>.
You can never make amends <fex>to Susan</fex> for standing her up.
Wyelander sought reparations <fex>for the brutal murder of his nephew</fex>.
How  can <fex>I</fex> make it up to you?
Between friends, amends can be made <fex>by apologizing</fex>.
He made it up to her <fex>with a bouquet of flowers</fex>.
He made amends to her <fex>that very afternoon</fex>.
Restitution was given <fex>in Milan</fex> with the Treaty of Abiselle.
Her <fex><t>tresses</t></fex> were golden.
<fex>Michael's</fex> hair is long.
I pulled Michael's  <fex>ponytail</fex>.
<fex>Syria</fex> has atoned for its support of Iraq.
Smithers is atoning <fex>for his misspent youth</fex>.
He atoned for his sin <fex>with good works</fex>.
